{include "default_salutation"} –

Celebrate 4/20 with ACLU-NJ, U.S. Senator Cory Booker, and special guests on Tuesday, April 20, at 5:30 p.m. for a free, virtual event on cannabis justice in New Jersey and beyond.

It will be a conversation about the state's historic progress and what our vision of New Jersey – post-legalization – looks like.

THE FUTURE OF CANNABIS JUSTICE:
A 4/20 CELEBRATION WITH U.S. SENATOR CORY BOOKER

Tune in for a conversation with U.S. Senator Cory Booker and special guests.

Tuesday, April 20, 5:30 p.m.
Zoom
Event Details will be provided after registration.

RSVP Today


This event will be moderated live on Zoom by ACLU-NJ Executive Director Amol Sinha and Campaign Strategist Ami Kachalia, featuring three important voices in the discussion on cannabis: Dianna Houenou, the Chair of New Jersey's Cannabis Regulatory Commission, Nafeesah Goldsmith, an advocate for Salvation and Social Justice, and Jorge L. Vasquez, Jr., a Program Director at the Advancement Project.

New Jersey legalized and decriminalized cannabis – but our work is far from over.

During this event, we'll discuss ways that New Jersey can ensure a more inclusive cannabis industry, reinvest in communities harmed most by cannabis prohibition, and continue to move toward cannabis justice during the implementation process and beyond. Join us on Tuesday, April 20, at 5:30 p.m.

We hope to see you there,
